full_text: PolicyCenter uses validation classes to validate entities on the policy graph. Under configuration, GSRC, GW, Policy, there are the validation classes shared across all lines of business. For example, Policy Period Validation, Policy Line Validation, Policy Location Validation, etc. Line-specific validation classes are under configuration, GSRC, GW, etc. LOB, and in each line of business folder. For example, NBA for commercial auto. NPA for personal auto. So on and so forth. All validation classes implement the PC Validation interface or extend a base class that implements PC Validation. Entity validation classes extend PC Validation base, such as Business Vehicle Validation. The subclasses have a Validation method. Personal Vehicle Validation class is another example. Policy Line-specific validation classes extend Policy Line Validation, such as PA Line Validation or BOP Line Validation classes. The subclasses have a Do Validate method, which calls other validation methods. Control-click to open Vehicle Validation. Control-click to open Vehicle Validator.DoValidate method. The Validator class contains methods that test for a single issue, for example at least one vehicle method. Policy Center uses validation levels to verify entities at certain levels before continuing. In at least one vehicle method, it first checks if the PA Line has no vehicles in it, and the current level is default or higher, it creates an appropriate message. Then another check is done to see if the current level is at least quotable, it adds an error message, otherwise it adds a warning message. The result variable is an object of PC Validation results. Vehicles-Wizard-step is a static final variable defined with value Personal Vehicles, which is the ID of the Vehicles step in the Personal Auto Submission wizard. When the wizard step ID is supplied, it creates a link to that wizard step, when the validation is executed but the user is on another step. Log into Policy Center as Alice Applegate. Create a Personal Auto Submission that does not have a vehicle. On the Vehicles page, try to navigate away by clicking the Next button. A warning message is displayed, because the validation is performed at a level that is lower than quotable. Click the Quote button. An error message is displayed, because the validation is performed at the quotable level. There is no link on the message, since you are on the Vehicles page. Click Clear to get rid of the frame. Go to the policy review page. The warning is displayed again. It does not block navigation. Click policy review again. Click quote on the policy review page. An error is displayed with a link to the vehicle's step where the error occurred. Users can click on that link. It takes the users to the vehicle's page where they can fix the error. This is the end of demonstration for validation class space.

segments.text: PolicyCenter uses validation classes to validate entities on the policy graph. Under configuration, GSRC, GW, Policy, there are the validation classes shared across all lines of business. For example, Policy Period Validation, Policy Line Validation, Policy Location Validation, etc. Line-specific validation classes are under configuration, GSRC, GW, etc.
LOB, and in each line of business folder. For example, NBA for commercial auto. NPA for personal auto. So on and so forth.

All validation classes implement the PC Validation interface or extend a base class that implements PC Validation. Entity validation classes extend PC Validation base, such as Business Vehicle Validation.
The subclasses have a Validation method. Personal Vehicle Validation class is another example.

Policy Line-specific validation classes extend Policy Line Validation, such as PA Line Validation or BOP Line Validation classes. The subclasses have a Do Validate method, which calls other validation methods.
Control-click to open Vehicle Validation.
Control-click to open Vehicle Validator.DoValidate method.
The Validator class contains methods that test for a single issue, for example at least one vehicle method.

Policy Center uses validation levels to verify entities at certain levels before continuing. In at least one vehicle method, it first checks if the PA Line has no vehicles in it, and the current level is default or higher, it creates an appropriate message.
Then another check is done to see if the current level is at least quotable, it adds an error message, otherwise it adds a warning message.
The result variable is an object of PC Validation results.
Vehicles-Wizard-step is a static final variable defined with value Personal Vehicles, which is the ID of the Vehicles step in the Personal Auto Submission wizard.
When the wizard step ID is supplied, it creates a link to that wizard step, when the validation is executed but the user is on another step.
Log into Policy Center as Alice Applegate. Create a Personal Auto Submission that does not have a vehicle. On the Vehicles page, try to navigate away by clicking the Next button.
A warning message is displayed, because the validation is performed at a level that is lower than quotable. Click the Quote button.
An error message is displayed, because the validation is performed at the quotable level. There is no link on the message, since you are on the Vehicles page. Click Clear to get rid of the frame.
Go to the policy review page.
The warning is displayed again.
It does not block navigation.
Click policy review again.
Click quote on the policy review page.
An error is displayed with a link to the vehicle's step where the error occurred.
Users can click on that link.
It takes the users to the vehicle's page where they can fix the error.
This is the end of demonstration for validation class space.
